intro: Arisaema parvum, commonly known as the small arum, is a herbaceous perennial native to the mountainous regions of eastern Asia. It features a striking, spatulate-shaped leaf that is often adorned with a distinctive purple sheen. The plant produces a unique inflorescence consisting of a spadix surrounded by a hooded spathe, typical of the Araceae family. Its flowers are unisexual, with separate male and female flowers on the spadix. Arisaema parvum thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
